unnormalised: Heavy rains across Maharashtra have caused significant disruptions to road travel. NH-48, connecting Mumbai to Bangalore, saw major delays near Satara after a landslide on 18/07/2024. Traffic was backed up for over 5 km, with many commuters stranded for several hours. The authorities managed to clear one lane by 3 PM, allowing vehicles to move slowly.

unnormalised: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) has cancelled 200+ bus services in the Konkan region due to waterlogging and damaged roads. Popular routes like Mumbai to Goa via NH 66 are severely affected. Passengers are advised to check the MSRTC website or call the helpline no. 1800-22-1250 for updates before planning their journey. Many private tour operators have also suspended services until further notice.

unnormalised: Further north, the highway connecting Manali to Leh, a favorite among adventure tourists, remains closed beyond Rohtang Pass. Reports suggest heavy snowfall, with accumulations reaching 2 ft in some areas. Border Roads Organisation (BRO) personnel are working to clear the snow, but officials estimate it may take another 48 hrs before the route is fully accessible. Travellers planning a trip should monitor weather forecasts.

unnormalised: Local auto-rickshaw drivers in Mumbai are reportedly charging extra, with fares soaring by 50% during peak hours and in waterlogged areas.
